title: COVID Home Safely Now (CHOSEN) Risk Score for COVID-19 Discharge
description: Predicts suitability for discharge in COVID-19 patients by assessing risk of needing supplemental oxygen, ICU-level care, or death within 14 days

parameters.name: albumin_level
parameters.description: Serum albumin level (if available for full CHOSEN score)

parameters.name: respiratory_rate
parameters.description: Respiratory rate (for modified CHOSEN score when albumin unavailable)

ranges.interpretation: Patient unlikely suitable for home discharge - consider continued inpatient monitoring and management
Borderline risk for discharge - clinical judgment and additional factors should be considered

ranges.description: Low risk - may be appropriate for home management
ranges.interpretation: Patient likely suitable for home discharge with appropriate follow-up and monitoring

references: Levine DM, Ouchi K, Blanchfield B, Diamond A, Licurse A, Pu CT, et al. Hospital-level care at home for acutely ill adults: a pilot randomized controlled trial. J Gen Intern Med. 2018;33(5):729-736.
Levine DM, Ouchi K, Blanchfield B, Saenz A, Burke K, Paz M, et al. Hospital-Level Care at Home for Acutely Ill Adults: A Randomized Controlled Trial. Ann Intern Med. 2020;172(2):77-85.
formula: CHOSEN Score = Age points + SpO2 points + (Albumin points OR Respiratory Rate points). Age: 18-45=5pts, 46-59=2pts, 60-73=1pt, >73=0pts. SpO2: <94%=0pts, 94-96%=9pts, 97-98%=14pts, >98%=21pts. Albumin: <2.8=0pts, 2.8-3.3=5pts, 3.4-3.7=15pts, >3.7=29pts
notes: Two versions available: Full CHOSEN (with albumin) and Modified CHOSEN (with respiratory rate)
83% sensitivity and 82% specificity in original validation study
Most predictive factor is albumin level when available
Not a replacement for clinical judgment - use as adjunct to clinical assessment
Best validated during COVID-19 surge periods
Consider additional factors: social support, comorbidities, patient preference
Full CHOSEN: 0-29 pts unlikely suitable, 30+ pts likely suitable for discharge
Modified CHOSEN: 0-19 pts unlikely suitable, 20+ pts likely suitable for discharge
